title: Chinese Government funds Phase 2 of Rumbek Kiir Mayardit Women's Hospital Technical Cooperation Project (Linked to Project ID#53331, #47301, #58594, and #53336)
description: On December 10, 2015, the Chinese Government and the Government of South Sudan signed a financing agreement for Phase 1 of Rumbek Kiir Mayardit Women's Hospital Technical Cooperation Project (captured via Project ID#53336). The purpose of this project was to maintain and support the ongoing operations of the Kiir Mayardit Women's Hospital in Rumbek. Phase 1 commenced in May 2017 and officially reached completion on July 5, 2019.   Phase 2 of the Rumbek Kiir Mayardit Women's Hospital Technical Cooperation Project (captured via Project ID#92076) also sought to maintain and support the ongoing operations of the Kiir Mayardit Women's Hospital in Rumbek. It commenced on May 23, 2019 and reached completion on May 22, 2022. Salva Kiir Mayardit Hospital — also known as Rumbek/Rumbik Hospital and Rumbek Kiir Mayardit Women's Hospital — was built with financial support from the Chinese Government (as captured via Project ID#47301 and Project ID#53331). It has 50 beds and a total construction area of ​​about 3,700 square meters. The hospital began operations in 2014 and it is reportedly one of the most modern hospitals in South Sudan.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government funds Phase 2 of Rumbek Kiir Mayardit Women's Hospital Technical Cooperation Project (Linked to Project ID#53331, #47301, #58594, and #53336)

# Description
On December 10, 2015, the Chinese Government and the Government of South Sudan signed a financing agreement for Phase 1 of Rumbek Kiir Mayardit Women's Hospital Technical Cooperation Project (captured via Project ID#53336). The purpose of this project was to maintain and support the ongoing operations of the Kiir Mayardit Women's Hospital in Rumbek. Phase 1 commenced in May 2017 and officially reached completion on July 5, 2019.   Phase 2 of the Rumbek Kiir Mayardit Women's Hospital Technical Cooperation Project (captured via Project ID#92076) also sought to maintain and support the ongoing operations of the Kiir Mayardit Women's Hospital in Rumbek. It commenced on May 23, 2019 and reached completion on May 22, 2022. Salva Kiir Mayardit Hospital — also known as Rumbek/Rumbik Hospital and Rumbek Kiir Mayardit Women's Hospital — was built with financial support from the Chinese Government (as captured via Project ID#47301 and Project ID#53331). It has 50 beds and a total construction area of ​​about 3,700 square meters. The hospital began operations in 2014 and it is reportedly one of the most modern hospitals in South Sudan.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Hospital construction and maintenance, healthcare sector focus

title: Chinese Government provides $25 million grant for Juba Stadium Construction Project
description: In July 2019, the Government of South Sudan announced that it had secured a $25 million grant from the Chinese Government for a Juba Stadium Construction Project. The purpose of the project is to construct a 15,000 seat stadium in the Northern Bari Area of Molobor East of Bilpam, Lado County in Juba. The new stadium will have a gross floor area of 21,000 and 1,600 training round which will have a combined capacity of 22,600. The main stadium will have a total of 18,000 seats. Construction activities will include the main stadium, a training ground and an integrated service center which will have accommodation, canteen, meeting, and training halls and storage with an ample parking space at the main entrance. China Metallurgical Group Corporation (中国冶金科工集团公司 or MCC) is responsible for project implementation. It is unclear whether works ever began.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government provides $25 million grant for Juba Stadium Construction Project

# Description
In July 2019, the Government of South Sudan announced that it had secured a $25 million grant from the Chinese Government for a Juba Stadium Construction Project. The purpose of the project is to construct a 15,000 seat stadium in the Northern Bari Area of Molobor East of Bilpam, Lado County in Juba. The new stadium will have a gross floor area of 21,000 and 1,600 training round which will have a combined capacity of 22,600. The main stadium will have a total of 18,000 seats. Construction activities will include the main stadium, a training ground and an integrated service center which will have accommodation, canteen, meeting, and training halls and storage with an ample parking space at the main entrance. China Metallurgical Group Corporation (中国冶金科工集团公司 or MCC) is responsible for project implementation. It is unclear whether works ever began.
justification: Project is focused on social infrastructure development with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Stadium construction with supporting facilities, categorized under social infrastructure and services

title: China Eximbank provides $989.4 million preferential buyer’s credit for Kadawatha to Meerigama Section of Central Expressway Project
description: On March 22, 2019, China Eximbank and the Government of Sri Lanka signed a $989,449,000 preferential buyer’s credit (PBC) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK PBC NO: (2018) 17 TOTAL NO.(474)] for the Kadawatha to Meerigama Section of Central Expressway Project. The agreement was signed between the Ambassador of China to Sri Lanka Cheng Xueyuan, on behalf of China Eximbank, and Dr. R.H.S Samarathunga, Secretary to the Treasury, on behalf of the Sri Lankan government. The PBC carried the following borrowing terms: a 20 year maturity, a 6 year grace period, a 2.5% interest rate, a 0.25% commitment fee, and an 0.25% ($2.5 million) management fee. The borrower is expected to use the PBC proceeds to finance 85% of the cost of a $1.164 billion commercial contract between the Government of Sri Lanka and Metallurgical Corporation of China, which it signed on August 14, 2015. China Eximbank disbursed $20,740,899.69 on February 24, 2022 and $30,828,753.09 on March 29, 2022. The loan had achieved a 6.6% disbursement rate ($65,419,324.37 out of $989,449,000) as of December 31, 2021. The borrower made no repayments between 2019 and 2022. The loan's amount outstanding was $51,569,653 as of June 30, 2022 and $65,419,324.37 as of September 27, 2022.   The purpose of this project is to construct a 36.54 km segment of the four-lane Central Expressway that runs from Kadwatha to Merrigama (Mirigama). This section is 24.4 meters in width and it commences at the interchange with Outer Circular Highway (OCH). It then passes over mainly paddy and uncultivated lands. After Gampaha, it runs mostly parallel to the existing railway line.   Metallurgical Corporation of China is the EPC contractor responsible for implementation. A foundation laying ceremony took place on July 26, 2017. However, the project faced major implementation delays due to the Easter bombings on April 21, 2019, the Covid-19 pandemic in 2020, and a controversy that resulted from allegations of overpricing. Construction did not commence until September 14, 2020. The project is expected to reach completion within 4 years (September 14, 2024). On May 26, 2021, a stone crushing facility was put into operation to support the project, which will reportedly require 950,000 tons of concrete gravel and 530,000 tons of concrete sand. Ultimately, the completion of this project is expected to directly or indirectly generate 1500 jobs in Sri Lanka.   However, it has also encountered debt repayment problems. On April 12, 2022, the Government of Sri Lanka announced a ‘pre-emptive’ sovereign debt default, noting that it would suspend debt repayments to all external creditors other than multilateral institutions. Its decision to suspend external debt service reportedly affected all China Eximbank loans with amounts outstanding at the time of the announcement.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as Phase 1 and Section 1 of the Central Expressway Project and Central Expressway Project (Section 1 from Kadawatha to Mirigama). The Chinese project title is 斯里兰卡中部高速项目 or 斯里兰卡中部高速公路（CEP）项目 or 斯里兰卡中部高速公路一标段（CEP-1）项目. 2. Section II of the Central Expressway Project linking Mirigama to Kurunegala reportedly progressed faster and was opened on January 15, 2022. This section of road was constructed by local contractors with local funds.3. On April 21, 2019, Easter Sunday, three churches in Sri Lanka and three luxury hotels in the commercial capital, Colombo, were targeted in a series of coordinated Islamist terrorist suicide bombings. Later that day, there were smaller explosions at a housing complex in Dematagoda and a guest house in Dehiwala. 4. The Government of Sri Lanka loan key number is 2019015.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
China Eximbank provides $989.4 million preferential buyer’s credit for Kadawatha to Meerigama Section of Central Expressway Project

# Description
On March 22, 2019, China Eximbank and the Government of Sri Lanka signed a $989,449,000 preferential buyer’s credit (PBC) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK PBC NO: (2018) 17 TOTAL NO.(474)] for the Kadawatha to Meerigama Section of Central Expressway Project. The agreement was signed between the Ambassador of China to Sri Lanka Cheng Xueyuan, on behalf of China Eximbank, and Dr. R.H.S Samarathunga, Secretary to the Treasury, on behalf of the Sri Lankan government. The PBC carried the following borrowing terms: a 20 year maturity, a 6 year grace period, a 2.5% interest rate, a 0.25% commitment fee, and an 0.25% ($2.5 million) management fee. The borrower is expected to use the PBC proceeds to finance 85% of the cost of a $1.164 billion commercial contract between the Government of Sri Lanka and Metallurgical Corporation of China, which it signed on August 14, 2015. China Eximbank disbursed $20,740,899.69 on February 24, 2022 and $30,828,753.09 on March 29, 2022. The loan had achieved a 6.6% disbursement rate ($65,419,324.37 out of $989,449,000) as of December 31, 2021. The borrower made no repayments between 2019 and 2022. The loan's amount outstanding was $51,569,653 as of June 30, 2022 and $65,419,324.37 as of September 27, 2022.   The purpose of this project is to construct a 36.54 km segment of the four-lane Central Expressway that runs from Kadwatha to Merrigama (Mirigama). This section is 24.4 meters in width and it commences at the interchange with Outer Circular Highway (OCH). It then passes over mainly paddy and uncultivated lands. After Gampaha, it runs mostly parallel to the existing railway line.   Metallurgical Corporation of China is the EPC contractor responsible for implementation. A foundation laying ceremony took place on July 26, 2017. However, the project faced major implementation delays due to the Easter bombings on April 21, 2019, the Covid-19 pandemic in 2020, and a controversy that resulted from allegations of overpricing. Construction did not commence until September 14, 2020. The project is expected to reach completion within 4 years (September 14, 2024). On May 26, 2021, a stone crushing facility was put into operation to support the project, which will reportedly require 950,000 tons of concrete gravel and 530,000 tons of concrete sand. Ultimately, the completion of this project is expected to directly or indirectly generate 1500 jobs in Sri Lanka.   However, it has also encountered debt repayment problems. On April 12, 2022, the Government of Sri Lanka announced a ‘pre-emptive’ sovereign debt default, noting that it would suspend debt repayments to all external creditors other than multilateral institutions. Its decision to suspend external debt service reportedly affected all China Eximbank loans with amounts outstanding at the time of the announcement.
justification: Project focuses on transportation infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of 36.54 km expressway segment, general transportation infrastructure project

title: Chinese Government provides police supplies to Sri Lanka Police
description: On December 5, 2019, the Chinese Government provided police supplies to the Sri Lanka Ministry of National Defense on behalf of the Sri Lanka police. The donation included patrol motorcycles, bicycles, laptops, handheld video recorders, and other unspecified materials. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.   Following the Easter Sunday terrorist attacks on April 21, 2019, the Chinese Government provided various donations to the Government of Sri Lanka: 1) 10 police vehicles on May 8, 2019 (Project ID #71784) 2) 100 jeeps worth LKR 1.5 billion on May 14, 2019 (Project ID #91210) 3) LKR 2.6 billion grant on May 14, 2019 (Project ID #88611) 4) X-rays and metal detectors worth LKR 60 million on June 19, 2019 (Project ID #88629) 5) Security equipment work LKR 765 million on September 27, 2019 (Project ID #88635) 6) Police equipment worth unknown amount on December 5, 2019 (Project ID #71776)
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Government provides police supplies to Sri Lanka Police

# Description
On December 5, 2019, the Chinese Government provided police supplies to the Sri Lanka Ministry of National Defense on behalf of the Sri Lanka police. The donation included patrol motorcycles, bicycles, laptops, handheld video recorders, and other unspecified materials. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.   Following the Easter Sunday terrorist attacks on April 21, 2019, the Chinese Government provided various donations to the Government of Sri Lanka: 1) 10 police vehicles on May 8, 2019 (Project ID #71784) 2) 100 jeeps worth LKR 1.5 billion on May 14, 2019 (Project ID #91210) 3) LKR 2.6 billion grant on May 14, 2019 (Project ID #88611) 4) X-rays and metal detectors worth LKR 60 million on June 19, 2019 (Project ID #88629) 5) Security equipment work LKR 765 million on September 27, 2019 (Project ID #88635) 6) Police equipment worth unknown amount on December 5, 2019 (Project ID #71776)
justification: Project involves donation of police equipment and supplies, which does not have direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of patrol motorcycles, bicycles, laptops, handheld video recorders, and other unspecified materials to Sri Lanka Police

The monetary value of this donation unknown.   Following the Easter Sunday terrorist attacks on April 21, 2019, the Chinese Government provided various donations to the Government of Sri Lanka: 1) 10 police vehicles on May 8, 2019 (Project ID #71784) 2) 100 jeeps worth LKR 1.5 billion on May 14, 2019 (Project ID #91210) 3) LKR 2.6 billion grant on May 14, 2019 (Project ID #88611) 4) X-rays and metal detectors worth LKR 60 million on June 19, 2019 (Project ID #88629) 5) Security equipment work LKR 765 million on September 27, 2019 (Project ID #88635) 6) Police equipment worth unknown amount on December 5, 2019 (Project ID #71776)

# Title

On May 8, 2019, the Chinese Government officially donated 10 jeeps to the Sri Lanka Police. The Beijing Automobile Manufacturing Plant produced the vehicles. The monetary value of this donation unknown.   Following the Easter Sunday terrorist attacks on April 21, 2019, the Chinese Government provided various donations to the Government of Sri Lanka: 1) 10 police vehicles on May 8, 2019 (Project ID #71784) 2) 100 jeeps worth LKR 1.5 billion on May 14, 2019 (Project ID #91210) 3) LKR 2.6 billion grant on May 14, 2019 (Project ID #88611) 4) X-rays and metal detectors worth LKR 60 million on June 19, 2019 (Project ID #88629) 5) Security equipment work LKR 765 million on September 27, 2019 (Project ID #88635) 6) Police equipment worth unknown amount on December 5, 2019 (Project ID #71776)

title: Chinese Embassy provides RMB 50,000 grant to Ape Patauw Special Education School (Linked to Project ID #91218)
description: On January 8, 2019, the Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka officially provided a cash grant worth RMB 50,000 (Project ID #71786) alongside a material donation of school supplies and sports equipment (Project ID #91218) to the Ape Patauw Special Education School in Hambantota.   In November 2017, the Chinese Embassy provided a separate cash grant to an unnamed special education school also in Hambantota (Project ID #91220).

title: Chinese Government awards 24 scholarships to students in Sri Lanka (Linked to Project ID#88552)
description: On August 8, 2019, the 2019-2020 School Year Chinese Government Scholarship Admission Ceremony was held at the Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka. 24 Sri Lankan students were awarded the Chinese Governmental Full Scholarship. The full scholarship covers tuition, lodging, living allowance, and medical insurance throughout the whole academic year, which values up to Rs. 2,500,000. Among the 24 Scholarship winners, 10 were for Bachelor's degrees and 14 for Doctoral degrees in different fields like medicine, architecture, translation, E-business, Psychology, Food Science, and Engineering, etc. The awardees will go to China in September 2019 to continue their higher education in well-known universities such as Zhejiang University, Wuhan University, and Peking University.  The program was first launched in 2016 and this is the fourth iteration of Sri Lankan students to study in China.  Project ID #88552 captures the Chinese Embassy's annual donation to the Sri Lanka Ministry of Higher Education and Cultural Affairs for the continuation of this program.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Government awards 24 scholarships to students in Sri Lanka (Linked to Project ID#88552)

# Description
On August 8, 2019, the 2019-2020 School Year Chinese Government Scholarship Admission Ceremony was held at the Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka. 24 Sri Lankan students were awarded the Chinese Governmental Full Scholarship. The full scholarship covers tuition, lodging, living allowance, and medical insurance throughout the whole academic year, which values up to Rs. 2,500,000. Among the 24 Scholarship winners, 10 were for Bachelor's degrees and 14 for Doctoral degrees in different fields like medicine, architecture, translation, E-business, Psychology, Food Science, and Engineering, etc. The awardees will go to China in September 2019 to continue their higher education in well-known universities such as Zhejiang University, Wuhan University, and Peking University.  The program was first launched in 2016 and this is the fourth iteration of Sri Lankan students to study in China.  Project ID #88552 captures the Chinese Embassy's annual donation to the Sri Lanka Ministry of Higher Education and Cultural Affairs for the continuation of this program.
justification: Scholarship program focused on education without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Education scholarships in various fields, no energy or infrastructure components

title: Chinese Government provides Rs. 5,305,000 to Sri Lanka for fourth year of Chinese Ambassador Scholarships (Linked to Project ID#88551)
description: On August 8, 2019, the Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Cheng Xueyuan, hosted a ceremony to award the Chinese Government Full Scholarship to 24 Sri Lankan students and presented a cheque to the Sri Lankan Government, for a donation of Rs. 5,300,000 for the “Chinese Ambassador Scholarship” annual program 2019, awarding 106 students with Rs. 50,000 each in 2019.  The "Chinese Ambassador's Scholarship Scheme" was launched in 2016 by the Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka and the Ministry of Higher Education. This is the fourth consecutive year of the scholarships following scholarships for 122 students in 2018 (See Project ID #54019), 55 students in 2017 (See Project ID #53779), and 54 students in 2016 (See Project ID #53789).  The 24 student scholarships in 2019 are recorded in a separate project (See Project ID #88551), as this project captures the annual donation from the Chinese Embassy.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title

The "Chinese Ambassador's Scholarship Scheme" was launched in 2016 by the Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka and the Ministry of Higher Education. This is the fourth consecutive year of the scholarships following scholarships for 122 students in 2018 (See Project ID #54019), 55 students in 2017 (See Project ID #53779), and 54 students in 2016 (See Project ID #53789).  The 24 student scholarships in 2019 are recorded in a separate project (See Project ID #88551), as this project captures the annual donation from the Chinese Embassy.
justification: Project is focused on educational scholarships without direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Scholarship program for Sri Lankan students, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: Chinese Government provides LKR 2.6 billion grant to Sri Lanka Police
description: On May 14, 2019, the Chinese Government agreed to provide an LKR 2.6 billion grant to the Sri Lanka Police. It is unclear whether these funds were ever disbursed and how they were spent.   Following the Easter Sunday terrorist attacks on April 21, 2019, the Chinese Government provided various donations to the Government of Sri Lanka: 1) 10 police vehicles on May 8, 2019 (Project ID #71784) 2) 100 jeeps worth LKR 1.5 billion on May 14, 2019 (Project ID #91210) 3) LKR 2.6 billion grant on May 14, 2019 (Project ID #88611) 4) X-rays and metal detectors worth LKR 60 million on June 19, 2019 (Project ID #88629) 5) Security equipment work LKR 765 million on September 27, 2019 (Project ID #88635) 6) Police equipment worth unknown amount on December 5, 2019 (Project ID #71776)
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Government provides LKR 2.6 billion grant to Sri Lanka Police

# Description
On May 14, 2019, the Chinese Government agreed to provide an LKR 2.6 billion grant to the Sri Lanka Police. It is unclear whether these funds were ever disbursed and how they were spent.   Following the Easter Sunday terrorist attacks on April 21, 2019, the Chinese Government provided various donations to the Government of Sri Lanka: 1) 10 police vehicles on May 8, 2019 (Project ID #71784) 2) 100 jeeps worth LKR 1.5 billion on May 14, 2019 (Project ID #91210) 3) LKR 2.6 billion grant on May 14, 2019 (Project ID #88611) 4) X-rays and metal detectors worth LKR 60 million on June 19, 2019 (Project ID #88629) 5) Security equipment work LKR 765 million on September 27, 2019 (Project ID #88635) 6) Police equipment worth unknown amount on December 5, 2019 (Project ID #71776)
justification: Project involves funding for police and security equipment, which does not have direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Grant to Sri Lanka Police, police vehicles, security equipment, X-rays and metal detectors

title: Chinese Government provides x-rays and metal detectors worth LKR 60 million to Sri Lanka Parliament
description: On June 19, 2019, the Chinese Government officially handed over three portable x-ray machines and five walk-through metal detectors to the Sri Lanka Parliament. The equipment would be installed in the parliamentary building in order to protect government officials.   Following the Easter Sunday terrorist attacks on April 21, 2019, the Chinese Government provided various donations to the Government of Sri Lanka: 1) 10 police vehicles on May 8, 2019 (Project ID #71784) 2) 100 jeeps worth LKR 1.5 billion on May 14, 2019 (Project ID #91210) 3) LKR 2.6 billion grant on May 14, 2019 (Project ID #88611) 4) X-rays and metal detectors worth LKR 60 million on June 19, 2019 (Project ID #88629) 5) Security equipment work LKR 765 million on September 27, 2019 (Project ID #88635) 6) Police equipment worth unknown amount on December 5, 2019 (Project ID #71776)
combined_text:
# Sector
TRADE POLICIES AND REGULATIONS

# Title
Chinese Government provides x-rays and metal detectors worth LKR 60 million to Sri Lanka Parliament

# Description
On June 19, 2019, the Chinese Government officially handed over three portable x-ray machines and five walk-through metal detectors to the Sri Lanka Parliament. The equipment would be installed in the parliamentary building in order to protect government officials.   Following the Easter Sunday terrorist attacks on April 21, 2019, the Chinese Government provided various donations to the Government of Sri Lanka: 1) 10 police vehicles on May 8, 2019 (Project ID #71784) 2) 100 jeeps worth LKR 1.5 billion on May 14, 2019 (Project ID #91210) 3) LKR 2.6 billion grant on May 14, 2019 (Project ID #88611) 4) X-rays and metal detectors worth LKR 60 million on June 19, 2019 (Project ID #88629) 5) Security equipment work LKR 765 million on September 27, 2019 (Project ID #88635) 6) Police equipment worth unknown amount on December 5, 2019 (Project ID #71776)
justification: Project involves security equipment donation for government building protection, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Portable x-ray machines and walk-through metal detectors for parliamentary building security
